intro: Cryptantha aspera, commonly known as the rough cryptantha, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Leguminosae family, also known as the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its pod fruits and nitrogen-fixing abilities. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It produces small, clustered flowers that are usually pink or purple in color. The leaves are simple and often covered with fine hairs, contributing to its rough texture.
